Text: Whose voice is that...?

Where are you?! Anna! Excuse me, but have you
seen my child?
A missing child?
It...seems like it.

Ah! I'm sorry, but you haven't seen a child around
here, have you?
Ack...! N-No, I haven't...

She's only seven years old...! She has pigtails...
Y-You really haven't seen her around?!

Pl-Please get a hold of yourself... I don't think I've
seen her. Have you, Beatrix...?
Nope. I haven't seen any children either.
Oh, how can this be...? Where have you gone, Anna...?

The mother, on the verge of tears, clutches a
flustered and bewildered Cid.
(Could this be...?)

Beatrix has an awful hunch. The kidnapping
incidents that Princess Iris told her about run
through her mind.

Seeing how distressed the mother is, Beatrix finds it
difficult to ignore her. There is no way to know for
sure without investigating.
She is not heartless enough to turn her away.
...Cid, I don't think her child simply went missing.
Huh...?

Can you give us some details about when she went
missing?
D-Details...?

Anything would be fine. It could help us find your
daughter.

Um... W-We were shopping together. We went to a toy
store on the main street that's been popular recently...
Anna was eating ice cream.

She was...holding onto my left hand, but she saw a
stuffed animal in a display window and ran over to
see it. Sh-She let go of...
Did you let go of her hand?

I don't know...! I didn't mean to let go of her,
but... I only took my eyes off her for just a
moment...

Before I realized it, my daughter...was nowhere to
be found...!

(...I don't think she just went missing. This is most
likely a kidnapping, like the ones that have been
happening with increasing frequency.)

(And to abduct someone in broad daylight...
What a despicable crime.)

(But how was she kidnapped so quickly? The mother
took her eyes off her for an instant.)
You just let go of her hand...
...What are you getting at?

I-I know it was the wrong thing to do! It's all
my fault...!

I mean...when I went out as a kid, my sister always
held my hand and wouldn't let go no matter what...

She told me she'd be worried if I didn't do so.
I don't think she ever let go of my hand unless
something serious happened...

(Cid's right. Unless she was distracted by
something else, I don't think a mother would
just let go and let her child run off.)

Did you see anything when your daughter ran
off? Like something that would unintentionally
distract you?

Ah...! Now that you mention it, I got disoriented and
it slipped my mind, but maybe it was...

Any tiny detail is fine. Tell me everything that
you can remember.

Okay... When my daughter spotted the stuffed animal,
I was approached by a man who said, "Have you seen
our child?"

(What's the meaning behind this? Was his child
missing too...? Or was a kidnapping happening
at that exact moment...?)

Meaning, that person is also looking for their child?
I don't see anyone like that...Maybe they found them?
Is something bothering you?

I'm just thinking... That if he found his child right
away, then he was pretty lucky.

(Cid's right. That man would be lucky....almost too
lucky.)
(If that were the case...)

...Cid, you may be right. There's no way that man
could be so lucky.
Huh? That's not what I was getting at though...
Uh, um...? Just what are you suggesting?

Stay calm and listen to me. There may have been
a kidnapping.
Kidna—?! N-No way...!

The man who spoke to you was likely an accomplice.
He knew that no mother with a child could ignore
someone looking for their missing child.

He diverted your attention just for an instant and
committed a crime in broad daylight.

O-Oh no... S-So what about my daughter...?!
What's going to happen to Anna?!
Don't worry. I'll find her and bring her back.

But please keep this a secret. If the culprit finds
out that I, the Goddess of War, am on the job,
I'm not sure what will happen.

Beatrix lifts her hood and reveals herself as the
mother opens her mouth in surprise. She nods
her head, trying not to make a sound.

(How should I search for her...? I should probably
inform Princess Iris right away, but time is of
the essence.)

(Besides, if the Knight Order were to come here,
it would certainly cause a commotion. It's best to
move in a small group.)
In that case...

Beatrix glances at Cid and notices that the woman is
still clinging to him as he stands there with a puzzled
look on his face.
(Was his perceptive opinion earlier...just a fluke?)

(...Anyway, what's important now is to pinpoint
the culprit as quickly as possible. I'll need
Cid's help.)

Well...it seems like I'm no longer needed, so I guess
I'll be heading back now...
Nope, you're coming with me.
Huh?! Why...?!

We have no time to inform the Knight Order. Our only
option is to solve this case ourselves, right?
I-I have nothing to do with it.

It'd cause less of a scene if you joined me, rather
than working on my own. Besides...
(I'd like to uncover Cid's secret abilities.)
What...?!
Anyway, just come with me.

N-No, I'd just hinder you if I joined. A-And you
know...th-there's a strictly enforced curfew...

Don't worry. If anything happens, I'll tell
Princess Iris to step in.
This is so unfair...
I'm begging you...! Please...please help Anna...!
E-Even if I do...I'm still not strong enough...

Don't be so modest. If you...I mean, you're the exact
person I want.
First, I want to check the scene. Let's hurry, Cid!
Awww jeez...

Is that the stuffed animal that her daughter saw...?
There doesn't seem to be anything unusual around
here... Did you find anything, Cid?

Huh...? Obviously not... More importantly, I think
I pulled something with all that running... Oww...
Are you all right? Don't overdo it.

You know what, I'm slow and weak and probably
a burden, so I'll just stop here and rest.

(I thought Cid would've found something by now...
but I guess I overestimated him. However...)
All righty. This looks like a good spot. Huh...?!
A-Are you okay...?

Ouch... What is this? I thought it was a wall, but it
looks like a panel...And it opens to a back alley...?

Is this a sliding door panel, disguised as a wall?
Maybe it's designed to hide the back alley...

I see...! So the culprit took the girl in their arms
and went down this alleyway! Great work, Cid!
I didn't do anything...
